metadata.name: Vestige #146
metadata.description:
Vestige /ˈvɛstɪdʒ/: a trace or remnant of something that is disappearing or no longer exists.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Vestige is a GT that creates colorful gradients by layering thousands of transparent shapes. This can sometimes take a couple of seconds (depending on your machine).

Notes on Responsiveness:

When resizing the window, refresh the sketch and it will assume the new window dimensions. Zooming in and out will require you to also refresh the page.

Hit the N button and wait a short moment to explore a different [N]ew Vestige.
Hit the M button to return to the [M]ain seed, which represents your own original Vestige . Hitting the M button to update the GT after zooming does work, however you'll have to refresh to view at the new resolution.

- Best enjoyed in fullscreen.

metadata.name: Po1nts! #310

Points!

Press J in live view to save a .jpg file.

Made with p5js in 2022 by UpOnlyFan

metadata.name: Hash Effects #12
metadata.description:
Hash Effects is an introspective graphical performance that discovers its own abstract origins and morphs it into concrete forms.

The origins of these artworks lie within the transaction hash that results from minting a unique edition of the artwork. Each graphical trait in the artwork is controlled by this origin, so in essence the transaction hash is responsible for the entire artwork.

While most generative artworks hide their transaction hash in abstraction, Hash Effects shows it front and center. Each unique artwork celebrates its own transaction hash as a graphical element that morphs into various shapes over different animation scenes.

metadata.name: Sparsely Populated Grid #254
metadata.description:
“Sparsely Populated Grid” is the result of an architect’s fascination with Cartographies and a crypto-enthusiast love for Neo Punk aesthetics. The first sketch, drawn by hand with Procreate, was made in October 2021.

This is an exploration on the field of Generative Cartographies, an abstract diagrammatic representation of a randomly generated area within the virtual IPFS world. Everything starts with an GRID of varying sizes and angles, subsequently POPULATED by a random number of forms. But, how to populate the grid? SPARSELY, of course, with just the right amount of superpositions.

The algorithm produces varying compositions of fourteen different forms, with seven possible mixes and ten colour palettes. Movement, made possible by its generative digital nature, follows sinusoidal patterns, as if the forms breathed and danced to an unheard music.

Besides, they never forget to celebrate birthdays.


// INTERACTIVITY

- CLICK or SPACEBAR to stop movement.
- UP and DOWN ARROWS to Disable/Enable graphic elements such as texts (wink).
- LEFT and RIGHT ARROWS (when stopped) to Move frames back and forth.
- Press 1 for a low-res PNG.
- Press 2 for a medium-res PNG (3x).
- Press 3 for a hi-res PNG (6x).
- Press G for Glitch (low-res).
- Press P for PixelArt (low-res).

If you want a different resolution, you can also add ?&res=xxx to the url to get your desired output. Then simply Right-Click SAVE the canvas -- experimental

metadata.name: Spirali #45
metadata.description:
INSPIRATION

Spirali was inspired by Tyler Hobbs' work with flow fields. However, instead of selecting random starting points for each shape to be drawn, which is more usual in flow fields works, I wanted to constrain the starting points to certain positions so that the shape being drawn could expand freely without the risk of colliding with other shapes, that's when I got to the spiral flow field.

WHY SPIRALI?

The name of this collection is not only a direct translation of spirals in Italian, but it is also related to Italian cuisine and my own personal experience in Italy. The relationship with Italian cuisine is due to the immense number of types of pasta that exist, including one called spirali. When I was a child I only knew three or four types of pasta, but when I became a bit older I was amazed to learn that there were many more. Actually, there are hundreds. Just like from the same type of basic dough, you can make hundreds of types of pasta, my idea was, from just one type of spiral flow field, to make hundreds of images. A strategy of forcing creativity by imposing a major constraint.

The name of this collection also relates to my personal experience because it was visiting Italy many years ago that I first became interested in art and design because of the beautiful buildings, churches and works of art that I came across.

DESIGN STRATEGY

A spirali is made up of several tails and each tail is made up of a basic element, which I called slice. A tail may have from one to thousands slices. It is mainly the variation in the number of slices and how they are colored that creates the different tail styles in each spirali.

The slices start at the center of the spiral and in each iteration they grow a certain length or split in two depending on the parameters used in the algorithm, which also determine the outline and fill of each slice when it is rendered.

FEATURES

The main features that a spirali can have are:

- Styles: Refers to the drawing patterns of each tail, that means, the shape, fill and stroke of the slices that form the tail. There are about 16 possible styles from which the algorithm will choose about 3 for each spirali.

- Zoom out: It is related to how much larger the flow field area is in comparison to the image area. There are two possibilities: 50% and 100%.

- Curvature: An arbitrary measure of the rate the tails of a spirali are turning. A spirali can have high or low curvature.

- Rotation: The rotation direction: clockwise or counterclockwise.

- Tails: The number of tails in a spirali.

- Palette: The palette's name. There are about 14 possible palettes.

COMMANDS:

- Press "m" to export a medium resolution image (2000px x 2000px);
- Press "h" to export a high resolution image (6000px x 6000px);

LICENSING

Please see license.txt file.

Twitter: @PauloSilvaGArt
Site: https://paulosilva.art

metadata.name: Splinter #18
metadata.description:
Splinter is a kinetic sculpture made from a small physics simulation. 
Physics objects are spawned with force and splinter on contact. 
A feedback trail of the simulation is played back after the simulation is stopped.

metadata.name: BULLET #12
REIN #172
metadata.description:
REIN

A generative approach to personal interpretation of reincarnation

It is not my right and job to prove the existence of reincarnation, but the concept makes a good dialogue for my heart and also is a fun challenge for my brain.

1. About the role:

The element on the screen is basically the metaphor for every object/person in your current life.

As the ACTOR, you can make choice under your instant willingness and travel in this world with limited time.

As the OBSERVER you can watch the above and question and dialogue with the ACTOR and alter its choice.

2. About the visualizations:

In order to present our big world in a limited 2D graphical approach. I shrink the dimensions and the detail of the existing reality.

Humans and Objects are dots, 3D entities like us become tiny dots (zero dimension) on a 3D space where their activity is backward translated to 2D perspective coordinates

Interactions between two entities are lines, and in our world planes or shapes were formed when interactions involved multiple people or objects. Which becomes an event.

We now as observer from the higher ground can witness the events’ change, progress, and karma by the continuous growth of the plane into various shapes.

Every world we reincarnated back into will have a visual color and an audio color tone. It is considered to be the theme of that particular life.

The final composition becomes a mix of the above, everything is merely the same but everything yet looks different. Depends on your perspective."

3. Some personal sharing thru creating REIN:

Life is short - I am happy if you are feeling annoyed and you feel the screen comes and fades so fast. Indeed this is my personal feeling about life, too short and things ended before you realize it.

Some life is super long and boring - I am also happy if you felt so. So sing and discover your song of life when you are in the room. It happens once only with this combination.

No time to prepare/predict/prejudge - but you can enjoy cause you/he/she/it/they/we will end in here suddenly. So enjoy the up and down, sweet and sour of every bit.

There is always an intangible target and goal preset to you, and it cast a line between you and it. You can choose to ignore it or be actively chasing it. But no matter which choices you made, your locus was left and shown in front of your eyes.

4. Observer’s responsibility and award
This work inspires me that in life we can both be the actors/actress and also the observer.

What matters more to you?
The background, your choice, or both?
Are you the observer guy who sits and doesn’t move?
Are you moving towards the [goal] linking with you? Do you keep chasing it?
Are you caring about the background more? Do you have a feeling they somehow related to you?
Or do you simply move your life freely without caring about the other happening?
Your voice is too loud or not?
Will you find the background noise too loud?
What can you do with it?
If the target connected to you is hollow and empty, would you still care about it?

And Why? Why do you feel so?
Which part of the above dialogue is related to your existing life?
What can we do/change/keep?
What you really can control?"


// [Click] - The sound of the work can be muted by clicking again the screen
// [s] - Take a selfie of this world and you inside
// [spacebar] - you can stop the time and walk/think freely like NEO in the matrix

Behind [REIN]
As a generative artist, I force myself to seek the possible ways to use these tools/skills/presentation forms.

In Traveler, it is about finding the difference between being alone and feeling loneliness
In FEA, it is about possibilities
In BULLET, it is about courage and faith
In REIN, I hope we can treasure what we lost and gained.

Art to me can be the visualization of aesthetics or a mutually enjoyable creative process for you and me.

Or like this time in REIN.

A journey towards our room inside our heart shape box.

metadata.name: Ghosts and drought #93
metadata.description:
Desertification and drought.
What remain from the old buildings now look like ghosts.
There is no life here.
It is the same everywhere. 
There is no future.

[S] Save PNG
2000 x 2000 px

The minter of each iteration will get 30% of royalties

Made with p5js
August 2022

ABOUT THE CREATOR

Obsukiy is a french painter and digital artist based in Berlin 
https://twitter.com/obsukiy_artist
